dev.kkorolyov.simplelogs

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.kkorolyov.simplelogs.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple logging interface for multiple levels.

    • Method Detail

      • applyProps

        public static boolean applyProps(java.nio.file.Path logProps)
        Applies logging properties defined in a file. Properties should be defined in the format:

        LOGGER=LEVEL, WRITERS...

        • LOGGER - name of a logger
        • LEVEL - the logger's logging level
        • WRITERS - list of comma-delimited files or streams the logger logs to

        Valid output streams:

        • OUT - System.out
        • ERR - System.err
        Parameters:
        logProps - path to logging properties file
        Returns:
        true if property application successful

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger()
        Retrieves the logger associated with the fully-qualified name of the class calling this method. If such a logger does not exist, a new logger associated with name is created with level , the simple formatter, and an appender to System.err.
        Returns:
        logger associated with the fully-qualified name of the class calling this method

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves the logger associated with name. If such a logger does not exist, a new logger associated with name is created with level , the simple formatter, and an appender to System.err.
        Parameters:
        name - logger name
        Returns:
        logger associated with name

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(int level,
                               Formatter formatter,
                               Appender... appenders)
        Retrieves the logger associated with the fully-qualified name of the class calling this method and sets its level and writers to the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        level - logging level
        formatter - message formatter
        appenders - output appenders
        Returns:
        logger associated with the fully-qualified name of the class calling this method

      • getLogger

        Parameters:

        level - logging level
        formatter - message formatter
        appenders - output appenders
        Returns:
        logger associated with name

      • exception

        public void exception(int level,
                      java.lang.Throwable e)
        Logs a Throwable at a specified logging level.
        Parameters:
        e - throwable to log
        level - level to log at

      • log

        public void log(int level,
                java.lang.String message,
                java.lang.Object... args)
        Attempts to log a message. The message is logged only if its level is <= this logger's level and this logger has at least 1 appender able to append the message. Message arguments can be supplied either as basic objects or Supplier implementations which will be lazily resolved to their string representations if and when the message is logged.
        Parameters:
        level - granularity to log at
        message - message to log, with '{}' denoting injection points for each arg in args
        args - arguments which are lazily resolved to their string representations (Supplier -> get(), Object -> toString()) and injected into message at logging time

      • logs

        public boolean logs(int level)
        Parameters:
        level - granularity level
        Returns:
        true if level <= this logger's level and this logger has at least 1 appender which accepts messages of such level

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        Returns:
        maximum level of messages logged by this logger

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(int level)
        Parameters:
        level - new logging level

        public boolean addAppender(Appender toAdd)
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • removeAppender

        public boolean removeAppender(Appender toRemove)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if this logger contained toRemove

      • getAppenders

        public java.lang.Iterable<Appender> getAppenders()
        Returns:

      • setAppenders

        public void setAppenders(Appender... appenders)
        Parameters:
